body_html:
If the issue pops up again, looking at the generated crosstool, e.g. by

cat $(bazel info output_base)/external/local_config_cuda/crosstool/CROSSTOOL

Should shed some light on the problem.

It usually boils down to crosstool referencing files via symlink, while compilers resolve the symlinks when outputting the .d files and vice versa.

body:
If the issue pops up again, looking at the generated crosstool, e.g. by
```
cat $(bazel info output_base)/external/local_config_cuda/crosstool/CROSSTOOL
```
Should shed some light on the problem.

It usually boils down to crosstool referencing files via symlink, while compilers resolve the symlinks when outputting the .d files and vice versa.
